cmCourseInfo.description: This interdisciplinary, skills-focused course parallels the other component courses of the full-time Academic Bridging Program, supplementing those courses and helping students integrate their entire Academic Bridging experience, while providing intensive, workshop-style training in the fundamental skills needed for success in further university studies in the Humanities and Social Sciences. The course will also provide academic advising and planning, to help students understand and navigate university culture. Open only to Academic Bridging Program students. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
cmCourseInfo.title: Introduction to Academic Studies

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

This course is available only to students in the Academic Bridging Program. For more information, please contact: Woodsworth College 119 St. George Street, Room 220. For office hours please check the program website. Phone: 416-978-4444 | academic.bridging@utoronto.ca | www.wdw.utoronto.ca

Delivery Instructions

Students will be informed regarding the delivery methods for this course during the enrolment process.

courses.name: Introduction to Academic Studies in the Sciences

cmCourseInfo.description: This interdisciplinary, skills-focused course parallels the other component courses of the full-time ABP Science Option, supplementing those courses and helping students integrate their entire Academic Bridging experience, while providing intensive, workshop-style training in the fundamental skills needed for success in further university studies in Mathematics and the Sciences. The course will also provide academic advising and planning, to help students understand and navigate university culture. Open only to Academic Bridging Program students. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
cmCourseInfo.title: Introduction to Academic Studies in the Sciences
